element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text: This algorithm converts polar coordinates to rectangular ones. This should be used when combining different anisotropic cost layers, since they cannot be added directly to get a total cost layer. They should be converted to rectangular coordinates, then X and Y components should be added separately and then the resulting X and Y total costs should be converted back to polar coordinates using the corresponding algorithm.

element.name: ANGLE
element.text: Cells in this layer represent the angular component of the vector in the cell. It should be expressed in radians.

element.name: DISTANCE
element.text: Cells in this layer contain the modulus(length) of the vector in each cell.

element.name: OUTPUT_DESCRIPTION
element.text: The following outputs were generated using slope and aspect as inputs

element.name: Y
element.text: Cells in this layer contain the Y coordinate of the vector in that cell.

element.name: X
element.text: Cells in this layer contain the Y coordinate of the vector in that cell.
